titleInfo.title: Studio portrait of Sandra Droucker by Eduard Wasow

mods.abstract: Photograph of Sandra Droucker, a pianist and Galston's first wife. Galston and Droucker married in 1910 and divorced in 1918. A handwritten note on this photograph dates it to approximately 1918.

titleInfo.title: Group portrait of Gottfried Galston and Mr. Pickman

mods.abstract: Photograph taken in Feodosia by V. Goldstein. Includes inscription and decorative imprinted floral mat. The inscription in the lower right hand corner states "To an actor of genius, a wonderful man, and a good friend, Gottfried Gallstone from his truly Isay Pikman, February 1, 1912, Feodosia, Crimea."

titleInfo.title: Photograph of Gottfried Galston at piano

mods.abstract: Photograph taken of Galston at approximately age 23 by Elliot & Fry. The date is handwritten on the reverse, "ca. 1902", which coincides with concert tours given by Galston in London.

titleInfo.title: Studio portrait of Gottfried Galston by Eugene Smith, 1912

mods.abstract: Photograph taken in Munich, Germany, with ornamental arched border incorporating the text "Gottfried Galston" and a signature. A handwritten note on the reverse attributes the photograph to Eugene Smith, March 1912 (?). Note that Eugene Smith is also known as Frank Eugene and Frank Eugene Smith.

mods.abstract: Photograph postcard of Gottfried Galston, believed to have been taken ca. 1916, when he served as a Lieutenant in the Austrian Cavalry in World War I.

titleInfo.title: Studio portrait of Gottfried Galston by Eduard Wasow, 1920

mods.abstract: Atmospheric photo of Gottfried Galston taken in 1920 in Munich, Germany. Galston was approximately 41 at the time of the photo and was living in the city. Eduard Wasow's signature is present at the bottom edge of the photograph.

mods.abstract: Photograph depicts Gottfried Galston on a bended knee in a striped suit and bowtie. Galston was approximately 44 at the time the photo was taken. Debschitz-Kunowski's signature is present at the bottom edge of the photograph.

Also present in the top-right-hand corner is an identifier from the catalog "The Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive" by Pauline Shaw Bayne.

mods.abstract: Photograph of Gottfried Galston by Alexander Piaget of Saint Louis taken in 1938. The date is handwritten on the reverse side of the photograph along with a stamp indicating the photographer's name and location.

titleInfo.title: Snapshot of Gottfried and Helen Galston in Yosemite

mods.abstract: A snapshot photograph of Gottfried Galston and wife Helen in Yosemite, California, 1941. Galston took this photograph using the camera’s self-timer.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Verso, snapshot of Gottfried and Helen Galston Tibbe in Yosemite

mods.abstract: The verso of the Yosemite snapshot of Gottfried Galston and his wife Helen. The inscription on the back of the photograph reads "Yosemite, Calif 1941 - Sitting on the John Muir bench in the meadows. GG keeps his eye on the camera w/ timer, + HG gazes at Yosemite Falls."

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection

titleInfo.title: Postcard of Gottfried Galston and Artur Schnabel

mods.abstract: Postcard of Gottfried Galston with pianist Artur Schnabel. The handwritten note above the picture indicates it was taken in Berlin in January 1900. Photographer unknown.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Verso, postcard of Gottfried Galston and Artur Schnabel

mods.abstract: Blank message side of "Postkarte". This postcard with photograph of Artur Schnabel on its front was never mailed.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Photograph of Gottfried Galston in the Wilcox & White recording studio

mods.abstract: Photograph of Gottfried Galston sitting at a recording piano in the Wilcox and White recording studio above the company’s piano/organ factory in Meridien, Connecticut. The piano was used to record the Artrio-Angelus and Voltem rolls for the Wilcox & White player pianos and organs. A handwritten note on the reverse dates this photograph to 1912, which coincides with Galston’s U.S. tour. The photograph is inscribed “With best wishes for a Continental Success, F. C. White & P.K. Wilcox” - probably the two other men in the photograph. Note the photograph of Galston on the wall behind him.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Verso, photograph of Gottfried Galston in the Wilcox & White recording studio

mods.abstract: The reverse side of the photograph of Gottfried Galston in the Wilcox and White recording studio. A handwritten note dates this photograph to 1912, which coincides with Galston’s U.S. tour. It also identifies Meriden, Connecticut as the studio's location.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Sketch of Gottfried Galston performing at a concert

mods.abstract: This sketch depicts Galston before a concert performance on April 2, 1908. Inscribed is the text "Avant le Concert le 2. Avril 08." In the background is a man with a mustache holding a money bag with the name "Dandelot" written above his head. This is likely Arthur Dandelot, a French music critic and and artist's agent.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

titleInfo.title: Portrait of Gottfried Galston

mods.abstract: Signed and dated monochromatic oil portrait of Gottfried Galston by Felix Meseck.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Pencil sketch of Gottfried Galston by Felix Meseck

mods.abstract: Line-based portrait of Gottfried Galston by Felix Meseck. The work is undated, but it can be inferred that the sketch likely was created while Galston lived in Berlin (1921-1926).

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Verso, pencil sketch of Gottfried Galston by Felix Meseck

mods.abstract: The reverse side of the sketch by Meseck includes an identifier in the top-right-hand corner from the catalog "The Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive" by Pauline Shaw Bayne.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Lithograph made for posters for Gottfried Galston's Paris concerts

mods.abstract: Original lithograph mounted on a board. The work depicts Gottfried Galston seated at a piano with ethereal figures participating in bebauchery emanating from the instrument. The figures include three mounted horsemen, a winged angel, and a crucified man.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Sketch of Gottfried Galston at the piano

mods.abstract: Sketch depicting Galston at the piano with female figures wearing hats roughly rendered in the background. The work includes the inscription "à Gottfried Galston, avec toute[s] mes excuses." This note from the artist Veber apologizes to Galston in case the caricature is seen as unflattering.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Verso, sketch of Gottfried Galston at the piano

mods.abstract: On the reverse side of the 1909 sketch of Galston at the piano is a page from a German-language newspaper, title and date unknown. There is a section for musical concerts, but there do not appear to be any references to Galston.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Postcard from Leopold Godowsky to Gottfried Galston, May 30, 1908

mods.abstract: A postcard sent to Galston while he lived in Berlin from pianist Leopold Godowsky. The postcard is from Galston's own stationery, with his name and address printed on it. The note was glued to an interleaving page in the Chopin section of the Studienbuch, and concerns Godowsky's own interpretation of Chopin's études. The postmark date is May 30, 1908.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Postcard message from Leopold Godowsky to Gottfried Galston, May 30, 1908

mods.abstract: A postcard sent to Galston while he lived in Berlin from pianist Leopold Godowsky. The postcard is written on Galston's own stationery, with his name and address printed on it. The note was glued to an interleaving page in the Chopin section of the Studienbuch, and concerns Godowsky's own interpretation of Chopin's études.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Studienbuch note on Busoni's analysis of Beethoven's Opus 106

mods.abstract: The provenance of this note is unclear. It was most likely inserted between the pages of this bound volume of the Studienbuch because it has been assigned the same catalog number as the book, indicating that it is "2 of 2". The handwriting is comparable to Galston's but has not been positively identified as his. The note itself comments on analysis by Busoni of Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 29 in B flat major, Op. 106.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Photograph of Gerda Busoni, Gottfried Galston, Ferruccio Busoni, and Sandra Droucker Galston

mods.abstract: Photograph of Gerda Busoni, Gottfried Galston, Ferruccio Busoni, and Sandra Droucker Galston. Sandra holds a dog in her lap and wine bottles are on the table.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Verso, photograph of Gerda Busoni, Gottfried Galston, Ferruccio Busoni, and Sandra Droucker Galston

mods.abstract: The reverse side of the photograph includes the inscription "L to R: Sandra Droucker Galston, Gottfried Galston, Ferruccio Busoni, Gerda Busoni." Note that this inscription is incorrect. The correct order is Gerda Busoni, Gottfried Galston, Ferruccio Busoni, and Sandra Droucker Galston. Also present in the top-right-hand corner is an identifier from the catalog "The Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive" by Pauline Shaw Bayne.

titleInfo.title: Gottfried Galston Collection
Gottfried Galston Music Collection and the Galston-Busoni Archive

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Plaster casts of Ferruccio Busoni's and Gottfried Galston's right hands

mods.abstract: Busoni's hand is on the left and Galston's hand is on the right. Both are laid on top of sheet music.
